snippet: The president argued that court decisions and state statutes discouraging “certain kinds of folks” from voting were threatening to erode the fundamental promise of the 50-year-old law.
abstract: Pres Obama urges Congress to restore key elements of Voting Rights Act on law's 50th anniversary; remarks come as Republican presidential candidates gather in Cleveland for first debate of 2016 presidential election, in which dispute over voting rights could figure prominently.

byline.contributor: Amy Chozick contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The president argued that court decisions and state statutes discouraging “certain kinds of folks” from voting were threatening to erode the fundamental promise of the 50-year-old law.

headline.main: Obama Urges Restoring Voting Rights Provisions
headline.print_headline: Obama Urges Restoring Voting Rights Provisions
